definition: to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.english: The studentapplies for suspension of study due to special difficulties or the student isordered to quit schooling by NMU.
sentences.chinese: 因特殊情况经本人申请或学校认为必须休学或停学者。

sentences.english: He admitted that he had thought about dropping out and taking the test again.
sentences.chinese: 他坦承一开始其实是想休学再重考。

sentences.english: It is now widely accepted that a gap year is more than a year away from studying.
sentences.chinese: 现在人们普遍认为休学实践年远远不止是一年不学习。
一名休学中的18岁女学生说。

sentences.english: He dropped out of school in 1994, and thereafter nobody saw him again.
sentences.chinese: 他在1994年休学之后，就再没有人看到他了。

sentences.english: He has a terrible attendance record at school and actually quit going school twice.
sentences.chinese: 他到课的记录很差，实际上还休学两次。

sentences.english: "You're going to suspend schooling? Why?" She became anxious suddenly.
sentences.chinese: “你要休学？为什么？”她突然紧张起来。

sentences.english: Now the rabbit even running all failed, have to take home.
sentences.chinese: 现在兔子连跑步都不及格了，只好休学在家。

sentences.english: The procedure should be completed before final exams scheduled on the school calendar.
sentences.chinese: 休学手续应于校曆明订之学期考试前办妥。

definition: to return to school (after an interruption)/to resume one's studies
to change schools/to transfer to another college
to drop out of school/to leave off studying/to interrupt one's studies
to repeat a year in school
(of an audio device) to repeat a recorded phrase (e.g. for language learning)
to return to the same school and repeat a course from which one has already graduated, as a result of failing to get good enough results to progress to one's desired higher-level school
to postpone one's graduation (e.g. by undertaking additional studies) (abbr. for 延後畢業|延后毕业[yan2 hou4 bi4 ye4])
to go abroad/to leave the country/emigration
to go to school/to attend school
